lead_paragraph: The largest single award, $176 million, will go to New York City to help build a new flood protection system around Lower Manhattan.

headline.print_headline: New York Area Gets $281 Million for Storm Protection
headline.main: U.S. Awards $281 Million to New York Region for Hurricane Protection

snippet: The largest single award, $176 million, will go to New York City to help build a new flood protection system around Lower Manhattan.
abstract: Housing and Urban Development Dept Sec Julian Castro announces New York Region will receive $281 million to help protect communities in area, which includes Connecticut and New Jersey, defend against and recover from natural disasters like Hurricane Sandy.
